extendedIngredients.name: broccoli
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup broccoli, chopped into small pieces

extendedIngredients.name: chicken
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups chicken, cooked and shredded (2 large, boneless, skinless chicken breasts)

extendedIngredients.name: rotisserie chicken
extendedIngredients.originalString: To make this recipe even easier buy a rotisserie chicken and shred two cups.This recipe is very customizable. You can add more of less vegetables and chicken depending on your tastes. If you want less spice you can leave the curry and turmeric out or just

recipes.title: Curried Chicken and Rice Casserole

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken works really well with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 27 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.Cook rice according to package and set aside.Heat a pot of boiling water over medium high heat. Add the broccoli and cook until tender. Set aside.Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add 2 Tablespoons olive oil and place the chicken in the skillet. Reduce the heat to medium and cook until the meat is no longer pink, turning occasionally and the juices run clear (8-10 minutes).Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet heat 2 Tablespoons of olive oil and saute the carrots, celery, sweet onion, garlic, turmeric and curry powder until vegetables are soft {about 12-15 minutes}.Once the vegetables are soft add the rice, chicken, vegetables and the cream of chicken soup {or the substitute} mixing well over low heat for two minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.Spoon the casserole into a 13x9 glass baking dish or casserole dish and place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes.Serve warm and enjoy!

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.Cook rice according to package and set aside.
Heat a pot of boiling water over medium high heat.
Add the broccoli and cook until tender. Set aside.Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat until hot.
Add 2 Tablespoons olive oil and place the chicken in the skillet. Reduce the heat to medium and cook until the meat is no longer pink, turning occasionally and the juices run clear (8-10 minutes).

Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet heat 2 Tablespoons of olive oil and saute the carrots, celery, sweet onion, garlic, turmeric and curry powder until vegetables are soft {about 12-15 minutes}.Once the vegetables are soft add the rice, chicken, vegetables and the cream of chicken soup {or the substitute} mixing well over low heat for two minutes.
Add salt and pepper to taste.Spoon the casserole into a 13x9 glass baking dish or casserole dish and place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes.
